alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 20 at 12:06PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Across the Defiance Plateau including Tsaile Red Rock across Navajo Nation. * WHEN...Until 415 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 102 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Up to 0.25 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Red Wash, Buell Wash, Bonito Creek, Lukachukai Creek, Muerto, Canyon del, Sheep Dip Creek, Black Creek, Lizard Wash, Black Rock Canyon, Cove Wash, Coyote Wash, Greasewood Wash, Blackhorse Creek, Wheatfields Creek, Quartzite Canyon, Whiskey Creek, Agua Sal Creek and Standing Redrock Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sehili, Wheatfields, Upper Wheatfields, Canyon De Chelly National Monument, Cove Chapter House, Red Rock, Red Lake Chapter House, Tsaile, Lukachukai and Navajo Reservation. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
